resources.title: Improvement of severe ME/CFS symptoms following surgical treatment of cervical spinal stenosis
resources.summary: Case study of 3 moderate/severe ME/CFS patients who were diagnosed with cervical stenosis following a cervical MRI. Measures of neurological function improved significantly after treatment.
resources.citation: Rowe, Peter C.; Marden, Colleen L.; Heinlein, Scott; Edwards, Charles C. (Feb 2, 2018). "Improvement of severe myalgic encephalomyelitis/chronic fatigue syndrome symptoms following surgical treatment of cervical spinal stenosis". Journal of Translational Medicine. 16. doi:10.1186/s12967-018-1397-7. ISSN 1479-5876. PMC 5796598 . PMID 29391028.

resources.title: Neurological and spinal manifestations of the Ehlers–Danlos syndromes
resources.summary: Connective tissue disorders may cause: migraine; idiopathic intracranial hypo/hypertension; chiari malformation; atlantoaxial instability; craniocervical instability; tethered cord syndrome; etc.
resources.citation: Henderson, Fraser C.; Austin, Claudiu; Benzel, Edward; Bolognese, Paolo; Ellenbogen, Richard; Francomano, Clair A.; Ireton, Candace; Klinge, Petra; Koby, Myles (2017). "Neurological and spinal manifestations of the Ehlers–Danlos syndromes". American Journal of Medical Genetics Part C: Seminars in Medical Genetics. 175 (1): 195–211. doi:10.1002/ajmg.c.31549. ISSN 1552-4876

resources.title: Signs of Intracranial Hypertension, Hypermobility and Craniocervical Obstructions in Patients with Myalgic Encephalomyelitis/Chronic Fatigue Syndrome
resources.summary: This study tests the hypothesis that hypermobility, signs of intracranial hypertension (IH) and craniocervical obstructions may be overrepresented in patients with ME/CFS and thereby explain many of the symptoms. In 83% of patients (171 of 229), brain MRI showed signs of intracranial hypertension.
resources.citation: APABragée, B., Michos, A., Fahlgren, M., Drum, B., Szulkin, R., & Bertilson, B. C. (2019, November 27). Bragee Bertilson et al. - ME CFS and Intracranial Hypertension. https://doi.org/10.31219/osf.io/qwn5hMLABragée, Björn, et al. “Bragee Bertilson Et Al. - ME CFS and Intracranial Hypertension.” OSF Preprints, 27 Nov. 2019. Web.ChicagoBragée, Björn, Anastasios Michos, Mikael Fahlgren, Brandon Drum, Robert Szulkin, and Bo C. Bertilson. 2019. “Bragee Bertilson Et Al. - ME CFS and Intracranial Hypertension.” OSF Preprints. November 27. doi:10.31219/osf.io/qwn5h.

resources.title: Cerebral Blood Flow Is Reduced in ME/CFS During Head-Up Tilt Testing Even in the Absence of Hypotension or Tachycardia: A Quantitative, Controlled Study Using Doppler Echography
resources.summary: Doppler flow imaging was used to measure cerebral blood flow (CBF) in 429 ME/CFS patients and 44 healthy controls during a head-up tilt test. CBF was reduced 26% in ME/CFS patients vs. 7% in controls. CBF reduction was > 2 standard deviations in 90% of ME/CFS patients vs 13% of controls.
resources.citation: Clin Neurophysiol Pract. 2020 Feb 8;5:50-58. doi: 10.1016/j.cnp.2020.01.003. eCollection 2020.Cerebral Blood Flow Is Reduced in ME/CFS During Head-Up Tilt Testing Even in the Absence of Hypotension or Tachycardia: A Quantitative, Controlled Study Using Doppler EchographyC Linda M C van Campen 1, Freek W A Verheugt 2, Peter C Rowe 3, Frans C Visser 1

resources.title: Evaluation of spinal cord compression and hyperintense intramedullary lesions on T2-weighted sequences in patients with cervical spondylotic myelopathy using flexion-extension MRI protocol
resources.summary: Extension MRI helps to identify significant cervical canal stenosis that is partially or completely absent on neutral and flexion MRI and to determine the exact number of levels to decompress surgically.
resources.citation: Zeitoun, Delphine; Hajj, Firass El; Sariali, Elhadi; Catonné, Yves; Pascal-Moussellard, Hugues (Apr 1, 2015). "Evaluation of spinal cord compression and hyperintense intramedullary lesions on T2-weighted sequences in patients with cervical spondylotic myelopathy using flexion-extension MRI protocol". The Spine Journal. 15 (4): 668–674. doi:10.1016/j.spinee.2014.12.001. ISSN 1529-9430. PMID 25485484.

resources.title: Diagnostic Accuracy of Videofluoroscopy for Symptomatic Cervical Spine Injury Following Whiplash Trauma
Diagnosis of Atlantoaxial Instability Requires Clinical Suspicion to Drive the Radiological Investigation
resources.summary: This article is especially significant for those who are symptomatic of AAI but have a normal Atlanto-Dens Interval (ADI), indicating Alar ligament compromise instead of transverse ligament compromise. Doctors and surgeons who are not literate in EDS will usually be unfamilar with AAI resulting from alar ligaments (as opposed to the transverse ligament).
resources.citation: *this article is not on MEpedia currently (as of 7/2020)*

resources.title: Living With Mast Cell Activation Syndrome
EDS and Its Fellow Traveler, Mast Cell Activation Syndrome
resources.summary: An introduction of the connection between MCAS and EDS

resources.title: Mast Cell Activation Syndrome
resources.summary: MCAS primer and MCAS multi-step treatment approach

resources.title: MCAS Medication Manual
resources.summary:  Therapeutic strategy for MCAD Active ingredients of medications, medical products, food supplements and foods for specialmedical purposes: Mechanisms of action, application, advantages and disadvantages Recommendations for use in basic therapy, symptomatic adjunctive therapy and in special situations (premedication before medical interventions and dental treatments, allergies, ana- phylactic shock, infections, vaccinations, pregnancy and lactation, mental illnesses) Guidance for the assessment of compatibility of products With references to the scientific literature

resources.title: MCAS - Histamine Food Compatibility List
resources.summary: Compatibility list for diagnostic and thera- peutic elimination diet at histaminosis (mast cell activity syndrome MCAS, mastocytosis, histamine intolerance), compiled from vari- ous sources and based on experience reports

resources.title: Coronavirus Pandemic: Notes on Therapy of COVID-19 in MCAS/HIT
resources.summary: As a precaution, do not rely on this infor- mation alone, but consult other sources and ask your doctor or pharmacist.Much less is known about what needs to be taken into account for HIT and MCAS sufferers. We are trying here to gather initial findings, vague hints, ex- periences and ideas on how HIT/MCAS sufferers can treat their viral infection – whether it is normal flu or corona virus – with drugs and household remedies.

mcas.title: Coronavirus Pandemic: Notes on Therapy of COVID-19 in MCAS/HIT
mcas.summary: As a precaution, do not rely on this infor- mation alone, but consult other sources and ask your doctor or pharmacist.Much less is known about what needs to be taken into account for HIT and MCAS sufferers. We are trying here to gather initial findings, vague hints, ex- periences and ideas on how HIT/MCAS sufferers can treat their viral infection – whether it is normal flu or corona virus – with drugs and household remedies.
